dcterms:creator: W3C
dcterms:description: The W3C standard PROV-O ontology encodes provenance through a directed acyclic graph where nodes represent entities, activities or agents, and edges label how nodes interact with each other.
dcterms:title: W3C standard PROV-O ontology

dcterms:creator: Idika
M. Varia
H. Phan
dcterms:description: A probabilistic extension of traditional provenance graphs that provides a framework for modeling uncertainty in provenance.
dcterms:title: Probabilistic Provenance Graph

dcterms:creator: Acar
U. A.
A. Ahmed
J. Cheney
R. Perera
dcterms:description: A core calculus for provenance that provides a framework for privacy enforcement in provenance systems.
dcterms:title: Core calculus for provenance

dcterms:creator: Ibbotson
J.
D. Braines
D. Mott
S. Arunkumar
M. Srivatsa
dcterms:description: A framework for documenting provenance using controlled natural language, focusing on the representation of provenance in a structured manner.
dcterms:title: Documenting Provenance with a Controlled Natural Language
